partintro.para: The functions provided by this extension check whether a character or string falls into a certain character class according to the current locale (see also setlocale).
When called with an integer argument these functions behave exactly like their C counterparts from "ctype.h".
When called with a string argument they will check every character in the string and will only return &true; if every character in the string matches the requested criteria.
Passing anything else but a string or integer will return &false; immediately.

section.title: Requirements
section.para: None besides functions from the standard C library which are always available.

section.title: Installation
section.para: Beginning with PHP 4.2.0 these function are enabled by default. For older versions you have to configure and compile PHP with --enable-ctype.

section.title: Runtime Configuration
section.para: This extension does not define any configuration directives.

section.title: Resource types
section.para: This extension does not define any resource types.

section.title: Predefined constants
section.para: This extension does not define any constants.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if every character in text is either a letter or a digit, &false; otherwise. In the standard C locale letters are just [A-Za-z]. The function is equivalent to (ctype_alpha($text) || ctype_digit($text)).
See also ctype_alpha, ctype_digit, and setlocale.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if every character in text is a letter from the current locale, &false; otherwise. In the standard C locale letters are just [A-Za-z] and ctype_alpha is equivalent to (ctype_upper($text) || ctype_lower($text)), but other languages have letters that are considered neither upper nor lower case.
See also ctype_upper, ctype_lower, and setlocale.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if every character in text has a special control function, &false; otherwise. Control characters are e.g. line feed, tab, esc.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if every character in text is a decimal digit, &false; otherwise.
See also ctype_alnum and ctype_xdigit.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if every character in text is a lowercase letter in the current locale.
See also ctype_alpha and ctype_upper.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Check for any printable character(s) except space

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: See also ctype_alnum, ctype_print, and ctype_punct.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if every character in text will actually create output (including blanks). Returns &false; if text contains control characters or characters that do not have any output or control function at all.
See also ctype_cntrl, ctype_graph, and ctype_punct.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Check for any printable character which is not whitespace or an alphanumeric character

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if every character in text is printable, but neither letter, digit or blank, &false; otherwise.
See also ctype_cntrl, ctype_graph, and ctype_punct.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if every character in text creates some sort of white space, &false; otherwise. Besides the blank character this also includes tab, vertical tab, line feed, carriage return and form feed characters.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if every character in text is a uppercase letter in the current locale.
See also ctype_alpha and ctype_lower.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Check for character(s) representing a hexadecimal digit

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if every character in text is a hexadecimal 'digit', that is a decimal digit or a character from [A-Fa-f] , &false; otherwise.
See also ctype_digit.
